Welcome to Independent Elementary School!
NOTICES:
Wedday, April 15 • Virtual Board Meeting via Zoom 7PM
APR 15 '20 AGENDA via Zoom.pdf
Directions to attend the meeting virtually are listed on the agenda.
INFORMATION REGARDING COVID-19
Check out the fact information about the COVID-19 virus from the CDC below.
2019-ncov-factsheet.pdf sick-with-2019-nCoV-fact-sheet.pdf
HANDWASHING INFO family_handwashing-508.pdf
PRESCHOOL SCREENING EARLY CHILDHOOD CLINIC
The PURPOSE of the Early Childhood Clinic is to screen children from birth to age 6 in a wide variety of developmental areas to provide information to parents about their child’s development.
Screenings are provided by trained professionals to look at development, speech, hearing, vision, and social skills.
For more information, please call Yellowstone-West/Carbon County Special Services Coop at 628-7903.
Please click Yellowstone West Carbon Clinic Flier.pdf for the Childhood Clinic flier with locations, dates and times.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
Click to download:
Emergency Handbook v.w.pdf
Student Parent Handbook 8.19-20.pdf
Parking Appeal Notice.pdf
RESOURCES FOR STUDENTS SUSPECTED OF HAVING DISABILITIES
Independent School District is responsible for Child Find identification and evaluation for all students suspected of having a disability residing in our district. This includes children birth through 21 years of age who are in public schools, private schools, are being home schooled, or are kindergarten eligible, but not enrolled. Early identification and intervention is essential to help ensure school success. Please note for individuals age 19, 20 or 21, the availability of special education and related services may be limited by school district policy. If a child is having significant difficulty with vision, hearing, speech, behavior, is experiencing slow development typical for his/her age, physical impairments, or learning difficulty, he/she may be a child with a disability. If you have a concern, please contact the following agencies so we may initiate the process for referral and assessment. Children: Birth to Age 3 Early Childhood Intervention; 406-281-5885 Children: Age 3 to Age 6 who are not enrolled in school Yellowstone-West/Carbon County Special Services Cooperative; 406-628-7903 Kindergarten through Age 21 Independent School (K-6) 406-259-8109; School District 2 (7-12) 406-281-5000
SB 307 Resolutions of Intent to Impose an Increase in Levies 2020 Permissive Levy Notice.pdf

As a member of Independent School, I pledge to:
Respect myself by making good choices,
Respect my classmates by treating them kindly, and
Take responsibility for my actions.
